macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

items.title: Indian Markets Open Lower on February 16, 2026
items.summary: Nifty 50 opened down 0.19% at 25,423.60 and Sensex down 0.18% at 82,480.40 in pre-opening session amid cautious outlook. Analysts predict consolidation with support at 25,000 for Nifty and resistance at 25,750.

items.title: Sensex and Nifty Outlook: Cautious Trading Expected
items.summary: Sensex faces support near 82,000 and resistance at 83,300-83,500, while Nifty support at 25,000 and resistance at 26,000. Bank Nifty consolidates at 59,500-60,800 with positive broader outlook.

items.title: US Stocks Decline Amid AI Disruption Concerns
items.summary: S&P 500 and Nasdaq 100 fell 1.4%, Dow Jones down 1.2% last week due to AI impacts spreading to new sectors. Fed rate cut expectations shift to July following strong non-farm payrolls.

items.title: Hang Seng Ends Flat Amid Volatility and AI Worries
items.summary: Hang Seng closed flat at 26,567 with intraweek high of 27,398, pressured by AI disruption and property sector issues. Tech stocks like Meituan fell 10.1%; US list of Chinese military firms briefly included Alibaba, Baidu, BYD.

items.title: USD in Spotlight with Fed Data and Volatility Ahead
items.summary: Markets eye USD rebalancing narrative ahead of core PCE, PMI, FOMC minutes; low Asian volatility with Nikkei up 0.02%, Nifty up 0.2%. Gold down 0.83%, Silver 1.2%, NatGas falls 7% on weather forecasts.

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

items.title: Global Crypto Market Cap Reaches $2.42 Trillion, Up 1.69% in Last 24 Hours
items.summary: The total cryptocurrency market capitalization has risen to $2.42T, reflecting a 1.69% increase over the past day amid positive market momentum.

items.title: Bitcoin Traders Prepare for Potential $60K Price Shock Amid Looming Liquidations
items.summary: Market analysts warn of significant liquidations as Bitcoin approaches the $60K level, heightening volatility expectations in the cryptocurrency space.

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

items.title: GLM-5 Open-Source Model Launched, Excels in Agentic Engineering
items.summary: Zhipu AI released GLM-5, a 744bn parameter open-source model with breakthroughs in architecture like DeepSeek Sparse Attention and Slime training, achieving top benchmarks in software engineering tasks such as SWE-bench (77.8) and Terminal Bench 2.0 (56.2), surpassing Gemini 3 Pro.

items.title: AI Impact Summit 2026 Opens in New Delhi with PM Modi
items.summary: India hosts the AI Impact Summit 2026 from February 16-20, featuring global leaders discussing AI policy, innovation, workforce readiness, and real-world applications; PM Narendra Modi emphasized India's leadership role in responsible AI.

items.title: Next-Gen SIEM Systems Leverage AI and ML for Cybersecurity
items.summary: AI and machine learning are transforming Security Information and Event Management (SIEM) with natural language queries, generative AI for incident summaries, and reduced alert fatigue, integrating as central hubs for AI governance in business operations.

items.title: 2026 Strategy Briefing Highlights Moltbook and Quantum-AI Intersection
items.summary: A guest post discusses latest AI developments including Moltbook, world models as AI's future, quantum AI for error correction, and US export controls on advanced AI model weights under the 2025 Framework.

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

items.title: Sega Hardware Designer Hideki Sato Passes Away at 77
items.summary: Legendary Sega hardware designer and former acting President Hideki Sato has died at age 77. The news was highlighted in a weekly gaming recap covering recent events.

items.title: PlayStation State of Play Reveals New Castlevania Game
items.summary: PlayStation's recent State of Play showcased new game announcements including a new Castlevania title, along with trailers and release confirmations. The event was recapped in a weekly gaming news roundup.

items.title: 2026 DICE Awards Winners Announced
items.summary: The DICE Awards recognized Clair Obscur, Blue Prince, Hades II, and Ghost of Yōtei as winners across categories. Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 also dominated at the event.

items.title: Saudi Arabia Eyes $7 Billion Acquisition of Moonton Games
items.summary: Savvy Games Group, a Saudi Arabian entity, is reportedly considering a $7 billion purchase of mobile studio Moonton, known for games like Mobile Legends: Bang Bang. ByteDance is in talks to sell the studio for around $6 billion.

items.title: Sega Announces Four Major IP Titles by 2027
items.summary: Following poor Q3 FY26 financial results, Sega revealed plans to release four major new titles for its mainstay IPs by 2027 as part of its future roadmap.

items.title: Top Pokémon Players Crowned at 2026 Europe International Championships
items.summary: After three days of competition, elite Pokémon trainers were named champions at the 2026 Pokémon Europe International Championships in London.

items.title: Five New Indie Steam Games Released This Week
items.summary: PC Gamer highlighted recent Steam releases including Roadside Research (co-op alien gas station sim), Polyarmory: High Calibre Love, The Prisoning: Fletcher's Quest, and Shadows of the Afterland, all out in Early Access or full launch within the past week.

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.

items.title: Trapeze Rebrands European Operations into Four Transit Technology Brands
items.summary: Trapeze has rebranded its European public transport technology businesses into four dedicated brands—ebblo, Grampian Solutions, Naviquate, and Nexfeld—effective February 16, 2026. These brands focus on ITCS platforms, journey planning, ticketing, and real-time passenger information under Modaxo.
